page.title: 04The River Exe,Exford
page.content: The river Exe rises at Exehead,high on the moors. It is just a little boggy area, very swampy with cotton grass growing around. It runs through Exford and past the school. The water for the village is pumped up to a tank, from the river and purified.Towards Court Bridge you can see the sewage works. There are lots of birds such as dippers,mallards,heron and the odd kingfisher.Many people enjoy the trout fishing. After Exford it flows through Winsford,Tiverton and Exeter.The river Barle joins it at Exbridge It has become a wide river by the time it has reached the sea at Exmouth.
